greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest integer m such that m-n is composite and phi(m-n) + sigma(m+n) = 2*m.
comment: For each n, a(n)>n and like a(n)-n, a(n)+n is also composite.
If both numbers p & p+2n are primes the x=p+n is a solution for the equation phi(x-n)+sigma(x+n)=2x. But for these many solutions x, both x-n & x+n are primes.
example: a(1)=25 because 25-1 is composite, phi(25-1)+sigma(25+1)=2*25 and there is no such number less than 25.
results.author: _Jahangeer Kholdi_ and _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Aug 30 2014
